text: Decent size of produce area. Lots of selection in the meats section. Would definitely come back!

We love this place!

The  Good:
Wonderful restaurant,  the food is  delicious.  The juice bar is on point.  The  tress leches whole cake is wonderful (8 inch 16$)!  We actually have come here to eat a few times this past couple weeks already!  The meats and produce are very reasonable. They were recently having a sale with 4 cases of coke for 11$.  Yes this market is competitive with prices.  The store is also clean, and organized.

The  Bad:  
Well such a wonderful spot is sure to draw a crowd, and it does.  The line to order food can run a long while, and after ordering you have another wait time, in all it can take up to 20 mins to order your food and then wait. This usually is in the afternoon, when I have seen it most busy.  Also the line in the meat department can be pretty intimidating. I went there and was going to oder some ranchera meat,  saw the line and turned the other way. 

Overall, yes I love this spot to eat, but if I was going to go grocery shopping I  would probably come in the early opening hours or before closing to avoid lines.
Great place to shop.. I was asking for "daikon" , this guy helped me right away. Friendly employees.  I will keep coming back.

Went on Saturday to purchase some meat for Father's day. I bought different types of meat. One of the ones I purchased was diced chicken. I went home and put in my fridge. On Sunday morning when I went to get meat out something smelled really bad. I opened the other meats and they were fine but the chicken reeked so disgusting. I can't believe they sell their meat about to go bad. Maybe health department needs to go inspect their facilities.  I don't believe I will be going to back to this store!!

They carry almost everything you'll need to make your Authentic Latino meal a success. From blood oranges for those exotic margaritas your co-workers talk about to tres leches cakes for your kid's birthday party. 

They also carry all sorts of fresh cheeses, tortillas and a full service butcher shop. In addition, they have a neat area to seat down and enjoy a nice lunch with friends or after shopping. No this ain't Sam's Club it's better than pizza food. 

I almost forgot to mention the full service bakery!

The customer service is awesome too, just remember to be polite and understand that you're in a Latino neighborhood store, they'll treat you like gold.

Gringo review inbound. I like this market because it's so needed in this neighborhood. The closest Mexican super market is 16 minutes away and that's too far! The meat counter here is supreme. For white folks that are intimidated simply speak English promptly and every worker will speak English with you no problem. If you're not Mexican do yourself a favor and acquaint yourself with the different types of prepared carne asada and jump for the one you like when it's on sale. I've seen some of the cheapest meat and produce prices in town here. It's worth a shopping trip for sure.

So far so good with this location. I usually have to Drive about 6 miles east or south to get to a Mexican market from my house. There are just some ingredients that you can only find at a mexican market, Especially when your trying to cook authentic mexican food. We really needed a Mexican supermarket on this side of town.

Some pricing here is great 1.99/lb for bacon!!! But other pricing is insane 5.99 for cream cheese. so if you are shopping for meat or produce the pricing will be great. The pricing for chips, dip, and other things is expensive. 

Also I do not speak Spanish so sometimes it is difficult to communicate there, I try speaking in broken Spanish and everyone is really nice to work with me in regards to it. 

The -2 stars is for the pricing of the regular items like honey, chips, oreos etc.

Employees where nice anf friendly ..They don't stick to they're advertised prices,not a big deal but when it's on a few items it adds up.I bought some cheese,had mold already growing on it(packaged the 15th,bought it the16th)..Overall they're prices a little higher then other Mexican markets,came out about $10 more then where I usally shop.Not worth visiting again in my opinion.

Everyone inside is helpful and sweet. We go in atleast 5xs a week for groceries. Prices are reasonable and less expensive than the competitors. Will highly recommend. They do have the Best posolé in vegas.

Love this store and my favorite part is the juice bar! they have so many options for fresh fruit, smoothies etc. they even have the tajin and chamoy available if you like. The store is always clean and the staff is always friendly!

Now open!

I love Latin supermarkets. For the most part, the prices are on par with Asian markets, but the places are usually much cleaner, and the staff more helpful, plus no surly attitudes. I don't mind the attitudes, as I'm used to it (it's just kinda our culture) but it's nice to see some smiling faces sometimes.

My favorite parts of these types of markets are always the bakeries. They have so many kinds of Mexican sweet breads and all the ones in the big case are only $0.60 each. They have about a dozen other kinds that are priced higher than $0.60 and those are in the cases.

There's also a large ready made food to go counter, a juice bar, a salsa bar and plenty of seating. I have yet to try the ready made food but they have tons of options. Next time.

For sure don't forget to check out the produce section. Today they had the hugest Fuji apples I've ever seen, 2 lbs/$1. As I walked by I thought to myself, "Damn those are some big apples! I should get some." Then a girl came by and said, "Wow those apples are big!" And then another guy, "Shit those are huge.". LOL Yeah they're big ass apples.

For opening weekend, they were pretty busy, but parking lot was easy to get in and out of, and checkout lines were plentiful, and wait minimal.

This is a great option if you live in the North West part of town, and previously Cardenas near the Meadows Mall was the nearest good Mexican supermarket. We'll be stopping by again soon for sure.

We love having La Bonita so close to home! My first trip here was just to check it out and buy some bolillos and queso fresco, but I came back with my husband a couple days later to stock up for the week. If you're looking for deals, there are plenty to be found.

I haven't tried anything from the hot foods area because meat is definitely the focus, but I really like the juice bar. I've enjoyed aguas frescas and fruit salad here and they also offer fresh blended juices. The mixed fruit bionicos with apples, melon, kiwi, and strawberry (no banana!) was so good that I got the mixed berry version on my next trip. Every department looked ready to close by 9pm on Saturday night and the store closes at 10pm, so get there earlier for full service shopping.

The store is brand new and very clean. My only concern is a freezer that seems to be malfunctioning because all the Goya tropical fruit purees had melted. Most of the Central and South American products are stored in this freezer so I had to pass on the Peruvian choclo and ají amarillo.

I love this store. I usually go to the Cardenas ( which is amazing too) but this is much closer to my house. The various of fruits and veggies super excites me. I get tired of the same old same old at smiths. This place has everything. I also ordered some dinner to go. Large portions and great food for a great price!

They sell expired meat here. Saw expired chicken, pork, ribs, hams,  animal feet you name it. And if they sell expired meat what other expired products are they willing to sell? Your health and the health of your family isn't worth the low prices. If you still want to shop here be diligent and check the dates.

Stopped by on a Sunday morning and didn't realize how close it was to my house. The store is really large and well organized. The Mexican sweet bread and rolls are immediately to the right next to the door so there was a small crowd of people to get thru to get into the store. Seems a little hectic to make your way past people to pick out your choices of items. They were soft and fresh. I priced some of the canned goods and teas and they were a little high compared to what I pay for them at the other Markets. I bought a few produce items and although they were priced competitively, I probably wouldn't drive here for their sales as I can obtain the same items closer to home.

Very friendly staff, beautiful store, very clean. Many amenities just while shopping: large hot food bar with many selections, with an area to actually sit down and enjoy your food. Very nice smoothie bar, and a beautifully stocked fresh fruit case and a neat fresh cheeses deli. The meat and seafood counter is very busy on weekends, but they go out of their way to make sure you get exactly what you need. My meat cuts were outstanding, and very competitively priced. Produce area is top notch, always well stocked. Huge spice area as well as bulk candy area, which I really enjoyed. Separate seafood counter always looks inviting, clean and well stocked. The prices of many things are cheaper here than at most major chains. They offer mainstream brands as well as specialty products. Very friendly check out staff as was entire staff all over the store. !La Bonita por vida!

The fact that they finally opened a Latin supermarket in the NW area is so convenient! Beats having to drive to Decatur and Meadows! It's been here for a few months now.

First off I love being able to get off work (grave) and stopping in for a some fresh pan dulce and bolillos,(Amazinggg) nothing better than a fresh cup of coffee and a concha!!! They open at 6:00am perfect for me to stop in and get a little groceries... hardly anyone at this hour! Quick stop!

The customer service is alright, I think they can work on that a little more. They do greet you as you enter, but they don't seem to take the time to ask if they can help you with anything. You have to approach them in order to get their attention.

Just got a torta today The cheese look yellow around the edges so before I bit into it I opened it up and found mold all over the sandwich the pictures you can see also have the receipt from here if anyone has any questions it was purchased at 1:33 today march 8 2017 stop going to Cardenas from what I seen on the news and now I find this so disgusting tried to call management several times got hung up on because they don't know English and they don't understand.

I'm galo glad this store open close to my house!! Store seemed very clean and organized. Produce was fresh and very cheap. Just the restaurant area was busy and a little disorganized, there was slot of people and no one seemed where the line was. However, one lady was able to take my order right away. The cashier lady was super nice and friendly.

Tre-Bon!  I like this for the produce sales, and carne availability.  Bakery can barely keep up with demand for my specific items :cream cheese pastry, apple filled pastry, etc.  

I either go for the cafeteria, or specific sales.  They take AMEX, so until I get a better cash back card, I use AMEX.  Some stores just don't take it.  (SAMS).  

So, bring a good attitude, cuz traffic lanes don't exist, produce is crazy cheap, and the meat counter, bakery, and cafeteria barely speak 'Merican.  

Food: 
- The cheese quesadilla is hot stringy, cheesy
- Nachos are huge
- I like the option for whole beans
- bread is made that day for tortas, probably for tortillas too. 
- ask for a roasted chile (jalapeño) with combo -free. 
- Salsa is always available.  

Ups: 
- lotsa parking.  
- lots of cards
- sale paper comes in the mailbox

Downs:
- no fresh salsa for sale without onions (marianas does)
- no chips container readily avail for easy chips and salsa
- aisles are tight for shopping carts
I just adore this market.....has everything I need and employees are nice. My kiddos also love this place the fact we don't have to drive 20 minutes just to get our Mexican bread and candy.

My first and last time going to this place. I would rather drive a little more and get better produce Cardinas than what La Bonita is selling. I purchased only fruit yesterday for a fruit bowl I was making for a Fourth of July party. I purchased what I thought was fresh fruit or somewhat near that and when I went to cut the fruit today almost half of the fruit was rotten or spoiled. The majority of the strawberries I purchased had mold on it as well as the blackberries. Not to mention they are a little overpriced for their produce. Very disappointed.
Love that they made one closer to us. We don't have to drive to rainbow And Flamingo. The food so good

This location is the new store that opened on Cheyenne. This store is just as big as the one on Rainbow as is fully stocked.

The one thing I like about these stores is that you can also buy food that is already prepared and cooked ready to eat. They have good specials and it's very inexpensive to eat there. 

They also have their own bakery, and have a section were you can pick out freshly cut fruit trays.

They also have a wide selection of meats, fish, and poultry. 

The store is a place where you can shop and have a good meal at the same time.

This store has horrible customer service,my son's came in there today to buy something to make for dinner.one of them had a bag of chips while entering the store and as they where checking out the cashier asked for him to pay for the chips he told her he already did he had paid for them somewhere else.i guess she called security and he was pushing up on my son not letting him leave the store.now my other son just paid for items why would they not pay for a bag of chips ask yourselves that. My son then asked for a refund no he was not polite about it and if I was there with them I would of asked to speak to a manager,you don't treat people like criminals or become physical with them.i just don't understand the mentality of these people I will be telling my family and friends about this incident and will never shop here.i will make the drive to Marketon. My boy's work they don't have to steal a bag of chips.

They have the Worst customer service!! the employees look unhappy! The employees at the kitchen are not clean! I ordered a hot dog and the girl who served me, used the same gloves to charge me and prepared my food!! (Of course they charged you first) the cashiers are rude!! Overall I'm happy with the bonita but not the customer service!!

My fav.  Food on point but the the beef soup a litle bit of salt but no  problem because it was  solved when theres in the salsa bar. And the coustumer service great.  Every time i go its something new .

This place just open like a month ago or more? I was super excited that it was near compare to the other stores.. when you walk in you can tell how everything is clean that's great but as I started shopping I noticed a lot of things are a little more expensive than Cardenas like the fruits/vegetables and cans/milk are a big difference, they have great deals on the meats and sodas I love that.. was super excited to get their green salas turns out it was super water down no favor super disappointed that's why I'm giving this place 3 stars they need to improve on it! And even the chicken wasn't marinated correctly not sure why because all the stores should be the same right? Unless they were not using the same recipe.. not sure if I'll go back to this location, I rather make the drive to the one on rainbow for better salas and meats ..

Este lugar es ridiculous siempre te tratan de sacar más dinero y tienen falsas marketing. He tratado de comer en múltiples ocasiones y siempre hay algo mal, esta vez ordene un desayuno donde claramente tienen la imagen que trae una bebida y la cajera por cierto de muy malas maneras me dijo que no trae bebidas, pero lo tiene en el menú, no me importa pero al menos arreglen sus menús es deshonesto hacer eso. estos markets la bonita la verdad me decepcionan muchísimo, que sus empleados

Love love love this grocery store! I always start on the right side as I walk in. Pastries for like 60 cents each! I also love getting a delicious drink before walking around. My favorite is the strawberry milk, watermelon and tamarind! Sighs... large isn't quite enough sometimes even though it's more then enough for others. If you get what I mean lol. It's that good! I love the fresh tortilla section. I usually buy the dough and make it at home. It's even better :) 

The meats are fresh and usually great deals on them. What I love the most is probably how cheap the veggies and fruits are! 4 for $1 on green onions? 4 for $1 on some bell peppers? Like that is only some of the deals but believe me, you can feed your family for a week in less than $25. This market reminds me of home back in the Bay Area. We have a Mi Pueblo which I love so much! This is just as great. You can't go wrong. Very friendly workers too. Yay for La BONITA!

There good fast food at their hot food deli bar is excellent Mexican food....their refried beans on their combo plates are delicious and not buried in a traditional Mex restaurant cheese glop...I would eat here before eating in most overpriced goopy food Mexican Restaurants. Soups are awesome and the the three taco  combo plate with a Diet Coke is a bargain at $6.99. If you don't have an appetite you will after staring at all the food behind the glass shields....Note: This is NOT Chipotle food

This is probably my favorite grocery store! I go for the fresh produce, made in house corn tortilla chips and different cuts of meat. 

Depending on my mood, I'll grab a snack or fresh smoothie before or after I do my shopping. 

With the great deals they offer, I get the opportunity to be creative in what I'm cooking at a low price.
